thread.title: Doctor Strange Blu-Ray Features Rumored To Include More Thor
thread.title_full: Doctor Strange Blu-Ray Features Rumored To Include More Thor

author: Megan Peters
title: Doctor Strange Blu-Ray Features Rumored To Include More Thor
text:
Doctor Strange Blu-Ray Features Rumored To Include More Thor   
It’s been a busy day for Thor . Earlier today, the franchise received a slew of updates. A brand-new synopsis for Thor: Ragnarok dropped along with a new behind-the-scenes photo. Now, rumors are going around that the special features for Doctor Strange ’s Blu-ray release, and it teases a new bit of Thor footage to boot. UP NEXT: Blu-Ray Release Date Released 
As reported by Heroic Hollywood (via Blu-Ray Forums ), it seems as if new Thor footage may be attached to the Doctor Strange home release. However, instead of it containing any Thor: Ragnarok goodies, the extras will expand on another one of the demigod’s adventures. Specifically, the purported features list contains the second part of Team Thor. 
If you are not familiar with Team Thor, it is likely because you don’t know the name. The alleged video will be the second-half of the mockumentary clip shown at Marvel Studios’ presentation during San Diego Comic Con. At the massive convention, director Takia Waititi shared a short video that explained what Thor was doing during Captain America: Civil War . The blonde-haired Asgardian was living it up in Australia with his bumbling roommate Darryl as he tried to figure out the mystery behind the Infinity Stones. 
For the full rumored list, you can read it below: Gag reelTeam Thor: Part 2Additional Scenes 
Right now, there’s no official confirmation about the Blu-ray releases’s finalized features, but fans are certainly hoping the Team Thor addendum is true. Shortly after the first video debuted, Waititi hinted that fans may see Thor and his lovable roommate reunite in the future. 
“I think you probably could see him again,” the director told . “There may be other little pieces of that thing that everyone saw that may just be a small part of a bigger thing.” 
A brand-new synopsis for Thor: Ragnarok dropped, and you can read below: 
"In Marvel Studios' Thor: Ragnarok, Thor is imprisoned on the other side of the universe without his mighty hammer and finds himself in a race against time to get back to Asgard to stop Ragnarok – the destruction of his homeworld and the end of Asgardian civilization – at the hands of an all-powerful new threat, the ruthless Hela. But first he must survive a deadly gladatorial contest that pits him against his former ally and fellow Avenger – the Incredible Hulk!" 
The cast of Thor: Ragnarok features returning stars Chris Hemsworth (Rush) in the title role for the fifth time; Tom Hiddleston (Kong: Skull Island) as Thor’s adversarial, adopted brother, Loki; Idris Elba (The Dark Tower) as the Asgardian sentry, Heimdall; and Sir Anthony Hopkins (Silence of the Lambs) again portraying Odin, Ruler of Asgard. Newcomers to the franchise include Cate Blanchett (Cinderella) as the mysterious and powerful new villain Hela, Jeff Goldblum (Jurassic Park) as the eccentric Grandmaster, Tessa Thompson (Creed) as the classic hero Valkyrie, Karl Urban (Star Trek) as Skurge, and Mark Ruffalo (The Avengers) reprising his role of Bruce Banner/The Hulk.
